overview_summary: Both neighbors have an unclear stance on new development, with no public statements found from either. One neighbor is part of a century-long farming family in the area (moderate community influence), while the other is a recently deceased owner’s estate with minimal local profile.

neighbors.name: Bonnie A. Dickerson
neighbors.claims: The Dickerson family has deep agricultural roots in Granville County; a Dickerson farm has been in operation since at least 1878 [NC Department of Agriculture](https://www.ncagr.gov/divisions/public-affairs/century-farms/EFG-Counties). A family member, Robert L. Dickerson of Oxford, received over $145,000 in federal farm subsidies, indicating active participation in local farming programs [EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=1&z=1&zip=27565).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a respected farm community member and emphasize how the development can support farmland preservation and honor the Dickersons’ century-long family legacy.

neighbors.name: Beverly Fleming
neighbors.claims: Beverly Fleming Ramey, 86, was a longtime resident of Franklinton, NC, and worked for many years at a local bank and other businesses in Franklin County [City of Oaks Cremation](https://www.cityofoakscremation.com/obituaries/article-271/). She passed away in November 2023, suggesting her Oxford property is now likely held by her estate and family heirs [City of Oaks Cremation](https://www.cityofoakscremation.com/obituaries/article-271/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Lived outside community; no public role

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to her Oxford-based family members and emphasize the project’s minimal disruption along with any benefits that maintain the land’s value and quiet rural character.
